description: Text Input Parser - Parse raw text input with indentation markers
steps: Step 1: Open the Sitemap Editor application
Step 2: Enter text with tree markers (├──, └──, │, spaces) in the input textarea
Step 3: Verify the parser correctly identifies depth levels for each line
Step 4: Verify the parser extracts labels correctly from each line
Step 5: Verify the parser builds a structured array of ParsedNode objects
Step 6: Check that parse success status is reported correctly
Step 7: Verify errors are detected for malformed tree structures
Step 1: Import TreeNode and ParsedNode types from the types module
Step 2: Verify TreeNode interface includes id, label, depth, children, and optional metadata
Step 3: Verify ParsedNode interface includes id, label, depth, and lineNumber
Step 4: Verify type guards isTreeNode and isParsedNode work correctly
Step 5: Verify createNodeId helper function creates branded NodeId types
Step 6: Verify NodeMetadata supports category, lineNumber, expanded, style, and tags
Step 1: Render the BasicTree component with parsed tree data
Step 2: Verify nodes are displayed in a hierarchical indented layout
Step 3: Verify nesting depth is visually indicated by indentation
Step 4: Verify all nodes from the parsed tree are rendered
Step 5: Verify the component handles empty tree input gracefully
